abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Wastewater Disposal
            in Tourism Centers for Dominican Republic was satisfactory,
            the sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was substantial, and the Bank and borrower
            performance were both satisfactory. Following are lessons
            learned from the project: The investment component of the
            project was designed to be readily managed, funded and
            supervised. The institutional component of the project would
            have benefited from a comparable, less-aggressive approach.
            The outcome of the project is totally consistent with the
            conclusions of the Quality at Entry Assessment performed in
            April 2001. In the opinion of the panel that performed the
            assessment, the LIL was adequate for piloting the ocean
            outfall technology. There should always be an institutional
            contingency plan for reform projects.
